image.altText: Gina on scam baiting zoom

props.synopsis: "Scam-baiter" Jim Browning takes Background Briefing inside the world of cybercrime and exposes the tactics used to con Australians out of nearly $3 billion a year.

title.children: We watched as an Australian got scammed. Trying to warn them was harder than you think

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: Mariusz Nurzsynski is given a partially suspended sentence and a Drug and Alcohol Treatment Order after pleading guilty to manufacturing and firing a gun.

title.children: Canberra man who fired homemade gun at man he thought stole his bike avoids jail

image.altText: A man wearing a jacket and headphones walking on a highway.

props.synopsis: Daniel took a wrong turn while walking 4,500km from Wilsons Promontory to Cape York to promote a universal basic income.

title.children: During a 4,500km walk to raise awareness on basic income, Daniel Hart took a wrong turn and was swept out to sea

image.altText: A man holding an umbrella, looking on.

props.synopsis: Video emerges of missing TV doctor Michael Mosley outside a business on the Greek island of Symi about 20 minutes after he was last seen by his wife at a nearby beach on Wednesday.

title.children: New CCTV provides clues in search for missing TV doctor Michael Mosley

image.altText: A for lease sign in front of a house

props.synopsis: With standardised contracts, signing a lease doesn't need to be as stressful as the search for a rental property. Experts share the red flags to look out for to ensure you're getting the real deal.

title.children: Red flags to look out for when signing rental lease agreements

image.altText: A bride in a white dress with a long train walks into a church

props.synopsis: The wedding of Britain's so-called most eligible bachelor has been overshadowed by rampant speculation about the two biggest stars on the guest list: Prince William and Prince Harry. Here's why it suggests the brothers remain deeply divided.

title.children: How a billionaire's wedding drama became a 'testament to where Harry's relationship is with Prince William'

image.altText: Car under water

props.synopsis: While this week's torrential rains across the state have begun to ease, the acting commissioner of NSW SES has urged residents to remain aware of potential flooding over the weekend.

title.children: Residents across NSW urged to be vigilant for floods as torrential rains recede

image.altText: A man stands in shadow, wearing a cap and looking out the window into a garden. The photo is taken from behind.

props.synopsis: The illegal use of ketamine reached a record high in 2023 in Australia. But as ketamine rises in popularity, so too do new chemical cousins of the drug — and their long-term side effects are "an unknown, unknown".

title.children: Ben knows taking illegal ketamine is risky but he's not worried about long-term addiction

image.altText: A woman looking at a landscape.

props.synopsis: Amid increasing prices for everything from food to energy and especially housing, some immigrants are deciding they would be better off returning to their motherland.

title.children: Why these immigrants are deciding to return to their motherland

image.altText: Greg Lynn court sketch - profile

props.synopsis: Greg Lynn told police his life felt like a Hollywood movie. This week, it played out like one as the accused killer stepped up to the witness box and defended himself in the Supreme Court of Victoria.

title.children: Greg Lynn's reality surpasses The Truman Show, as he testifies in his own murder trial

image.altText: A generic stock photo of a "hacker" superimposed with words like "For Sale, information on citizens, price: $50,000".

props.synopsis: Doctors and pharmacists named in a sample of stolen MediSecure data up for sale on the dark web say they are yet to be contacted by the company despite their information being available online for over a week.

title.children: Australian doctors' details are up for sale on the dark web. They only found out when the ABC called

image.altText: Two women to the left are wearing white t shirts and smiling, next to a blonde model with gold prosthetic legs

props.synopsis: When a popular Australian podcast recently got into hot water over an episode about toxic shock syndrome (TSS), the incident reflected the consequences of medical misinformation and TSS confusion. So what exactly is TSS, and how worried should women be?

title.children: From sharing one woman's emotional story, an Australian podcast faced a fallout over medical misinformation

image.altText: A man is seen from behind as he holds his hands on his head and looks up at a screen with numbers and graphs

props.synopsis: Despite teetering on the edge of it, few economists are forecasting an Australian recession anytime soon. But there's one obvious threat missing from the commentary: panic.

title.children: A black swan event would wipe out Australian superannuation and the economy with it

image.altText: A row of tents in front of a long building at the Australian National University campus.

props.synopsis: ANU vice-chancellor Genevieve Bell tells a Senate estimates hearing that two students connected to pro-Palestinian protests on campus have been expelled, and are among 10 disciplinary actions launched since the protest began.

title.children: Disciplinary action taken against 10 students since ANU pro-Palestine encampment began, Senate estimates hears

image.altText: Chickens stick their heads out from cages at a farm.

props.synopsis: The World Health Organization (WHO) has confirmed the child who contracted Australia's first human case of a "severe" subtype of bird flu was likely exposed during a trip to India last month.

title.children: WHO confirms Australia's first human case of 'severe' bird flu subtype likely came from India

image.altText: An ADF Eurocopter Tiger smoking on a Gold Coast golf course.

props.synopsis: The Tiger helicopter was on display at the resort this week when it experienced difficulties before take-off.

title.children: ADF chopper suffers 'minor technical fault' at Gold Coast golf course

image.altText: Three women, Alison Scott, Jacqueline Darley and Alison Evans, look seriously at the camera

props.synopsis: As WA wrestles with an epidemic of domestic violence, these experts say investigations are not enough and want to see urgent changes to stop more women from being murdered.

title.children: These women want to see urgent changes in domestic violence responses to stop more senseless murders

image.altText: Anya Culling smiles

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australians are lacing up their trainers every single day as the running boom continues apace and, incredibly, most of them seem to be enjoying it. Or are they smiling for a different reason?

title.children: Having trouble with your run? The experts say that all you need to do is smile your way past it

image.altText: Lyudmila Oluanovska passes a celebrating Laura Garcia-Caro

props.synopsis: The shocking moment when Spanish race walker Laura García-Caro loses a possible European Championship bronze medal after celebrating too early.

title.children: Watch the shocking moment when a walker loses a race celebrating too early

image.altText: Skiers look over to the opposing mountain ridge

props.synopsis: Away from the sunburnt beaches, hot dusty gums, and red deserts, news for Australia's ski fields hasn't been good for years. But new research shows while the snow season is getting shorter, there's hope to turn things around.

title.children: Australia's ski fields are on a downhill slope, but scientists show there's an off-ramp

image.altText: A court sketch of Naomi biden. Her black hair is tied in a bun and she's wearing a black suit.

props.synopsis: Hunter Biden's daughter has testified in her father's defence that he seemed to respond well to drug treatment in the weeks before he bought a gun that prosecutors say he obtained illegally by failing to disclose his addiction.

title.children: 'I'm really sorry dad, I can't take this': Hunter Biden's daughter testifies about his drug use at his criminal gun trial

image.altText: A photo of a man on a missing persons poster

props.synopsis: In the Australian outback, mysteries have a way of shifting and distorting — and none more so than the enduring saga of a Larrimah man and his kelpie who never returned to the pub.

title.children: Paddy Moriarty case enters grim new phase as an outback murder mystery that may never be solved

image.altText: Lin Zijuan sitting with her chin on her hands in a restaurant.

props.synopsis: Many young people in China are using live-streamed blind dates — with sometimes hundreds of people watching — to meet potential partners.

title.children: 'Convenient and effective': A new dating trend is taking off in China

image.altText: A blond man in a short sleeve button down and glasses in front of a chalkboard

props.synopsis: Anyone But You might have elevated Glen Powell to name-brand status with your mum and her friends, but Hit Man is his most defining achievement (so far).

title.children: Part rom-com, part cop thriller, with a dash of philosophy, Hit Man is wildly entertaining

image.altText: Graphic of man in high vis with an arrow pointing to him dressed in a black polo

props.synopsis: Gen Z and millennials are job hopping much more frequently than their boomer bosses in the pursuit of happiness — and it's putting pressure on employers.

title.children: Gen Zs like Flynn are happy to career hop until they find a job that makes them happy

image.altText: Marion Scrymgour

props.synopsis: Senator Lidia Thorpe has levelled scrutiny on the Northern Land Council over the spending of hundreds of thousands of dollars in federal COVID stimulus funding.

title.children: 'I've got nothing to hide': Federal MP reacts after accusations of misusing COVID funding

image.altText: Denmark's Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen speaking into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen was "hit" by a man in a Copenhagen square on Friday, her office has said, adding that the man had been arrested.

title.children: Denmark's prime minister 'hit' by man in Copenhagen

image.altText: Carlos Alcaraz holds up his hands

props.synopsis: Carlos Alcaraz reaches the French Open final after a five-set epic, and will face Alexander Zverev, whose domestic violence case in Germany was also resolved on Friday.

title.children: Alcaraz wins five-set epic at French Open as Alexander Zverev settles domestic violence case with ex

image.altText: An aerial shot of a water truck on a brown dirt road, with rural land on either side.

props.synopsis: Dry paddocks, dead and dying trees, and empty water tanks — that's the grim situation gripping Toodyay in Western Australia as regional towns pay the price of a long, dry summer.

title.children: Paddocks upon paddocks of dry crops are not normal here at this time of year

image.altText: A composite image of three photos of avocadoes, people putting food on their plates and a farmer looking into a box

props.synopsis: From Melbourne to Mumbai, demand for avocado is on the rise in India, creating a big opportunity for Australian farmers who might otherwise dump fruit due to oversupply.

title.children: India goes for 'green gold' as Australian avocados grow in popularity in massive new export market

image.altText: A Tasmanian tiger stands in an enclosure.

props.synopsis: Even though we might be able to bring the thylacine back from extinction this science exhibition asks whether we should.

title.children: 'Should we actually be doing this?' Thylacine de-extinction project questioned in new science exhibition

image.altText: Harry Kane holds his mouth

props.synopsis: England heads into the Euro 2024 tournament after suffering a defeat against Iceland that will bring Three Lions supporters bad memories of the loss to the same team in the 2016 tournament.

title.children: 'Dismal' England suffers shock loss against Iceland

image.altText: Generic myki card

props.synopsis: Public Transport Victoria has confirmed a small number of people with unregistered myki cards have had funds stolen from their accounts.

title.children: Scammers find exploit in myki cards allowing them to steal funds from Victorian commuters

image.altText: The character of Penelope Featherington stands alone at a ball, in a vivid green gown.

props.synopsis: Courtesy of film, social media and video games, classical music is reaching audiences it never has before. The ABC Classic 100 has been charting the change.

title.children: Classical music's audience is changing and Bridgerton and The Legend of Zelda are proof
